As the President said tonight: 

Let's finish the job.

Tonight, we all heard @POTUS lay out his vision for a better America‚Äîbacked by the powerful results of a progressive agenda put into action.

If we continue taking on corporate power, investing in working families, and embracing equitable policymaking, we can continue to deliver.

The President has also shown he can make enormous progress with executive authority, taking significant action on our Executive Action Agenda.

We'll soon release an updated 2023 agenda. And we'll continue to ensure equitable implementation of investments we passed last Congress.

As @POTUS made clear, Democrats will also need to hold the line against Republican extremism, including attempts to force a default on the debt limit and gut Social Security, Medicare, and other critical programs.

We'll be a party not only of opposition, but also of proposition.

‚ûñAddress the crises of affordable housing, child and home care, and care worker pay
‚ûñEnsure the wealthy and corporations pay their fair share
‚ûñProvide a fair, humane process for all seeking safety in the U.S. and continue expanding legal pathways and protections for immigrants

Progressives will continue to be partners in the fights ahead to:
‚ûñRaise the overtime threshold so millions are paid for their work
‚ûñContinue the fight to end gun violence and to crack down on Big Pharma
‚ûñClean up the power sector and lower emissions
‚ûñRestore competition

Progressives are proud champions of the President's bold antitrust agenda, and we were thrilled to hear him tout it tonight.

And as the mother of transgender child, @RepJayapal was deeply moved to hear him rally our country to defend the transgender community.

In the wake of the killing of Tyre Nichols and too many before him, we must address our communities' urgent demands to change law enforcement‚Äôs use of force.

We must expand voting rights and codify the right to abortion ‚Äî fundamental freedoms without which our democracy suffers.

Housing and care are some of the biggest inflationary costs hitting working people ‚Äî that's why we pushed so hard to deliver them in the last Congress.

We got incredibly close, and won't stop until they're law.

It is so important the President called out the need to finish the rest of his agenda.

We need universal child care, home care, and pre-K, paid sick and family leave, and bold investments in housing.

Let's be clear: 

Republicans want to cut food stamps, Social Security, and Medicare.

Democrats want to tax the wealthiest to pay their fair share, expand Social Security and Medicare, and lower costs for working and poor Americans.

We began this fight for increased tax fairness in the last Congress. 

Increased tax revenue through fair and equitable means, combined with strong investments in the tools people need to get back to work and take care of their families, is exactly how we build a strong economy.
We applaud @POTUS‚Äô bold call for new taxes on billionaires and on stock buybacks that enrich wealthy shareholders, but discourage investments in workers and lower prices for consumers.

Thanks to the President and Democrats in Congress, there was a lot to celebrate:

Unemployment is at its lowest in 5 decades. Real wages are up, particularly in lower-paid sectors. American manufacturing is on the upswing. We're on track achieve 80% clean electricity by 2030.
